snippet: The veteran, Merrill Newman, 85, who has been held since Oct. 26, read excerpts from the apology from several sheets of white paper.
abstract: North Korea releases video of captive American veteran Merrill Newman reading written apology for 'hostile acts' during Korean War and on recent visit to country.

byline.contributor: Michael Schwirtz contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The veteran, Merrill Newman, 85, who has been held since Oct. 26, read excerpts from the apology from several sheets of white paper.

headline.main: North Korea Releases a Video of a U.S. Veteran Confessing to ‘Hostile Acts’
headline.print_headline: North Korea Releases a Video of a U.S. Veteran Confessing to ‘Hostile Acts’

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
